President.introduction: Hi everyone! I am Ryan Schager, and I am so excited for the opportunity to be your next Class Board President! I have absolutely loved my time here so far, I cannot wait to spend the next four years alongside such an amazing group of people. I would love the opportunity to unite our class through fun events, to incorporate new traditions for years to come, and to establish the Class of 2026 as a vibrant, close-knit community! I love making new friends and meeting new people, make sure to say hi or reach out to me at any time! :)
President.name: Ryan Schager
platform_points: Working for the Student Body - I will always prioritize peer feedback on how I can work to make your Penn experience most favorable! Feel free to reach out!
School Spirit + Unity - I would like to highly promote school spirit through creating new events that the Class of 2026 will establish as traditions at Penn for years to come.
Free + Expanded Merchandise - I want everyone to feel proud to be a part of the Class of 2026, and to proudly wear free 2026 t-shirts + sunglasses given out at events!
Water Fountains in Residential Buildings - I would like to incorporate more accessible purified water fountains through residential buildings to benefit the student body.
Ice Machines in Residential Buildings - I would also like to provide ice machines throughout lounges of residential buildings to provide more accessible ice to students.
External Funding - I plan to work tirelessly to host events to increase our funding + budget through outside sources in order to increase accessibility giving back to our class.

President.introduction: Hey everyone! My name is Hannah Kim and I am in the College of Arts and Sciences, studying chemistry, on the pre-med track. I love all sports, but tennis is my favorite one. I am running for your class president to make our time here fun and to further the traditions of our school. As the executive president of my high school last year, I am experienced in student government and hope to use my knowledge to my advantage. Your support would be greatly appreciated.Thank you!
President.name: Hannah Kim
platform_points: My goal is to ensure that every student’s voice is heard. I want to engage with everyone and receive feedback or suggestions.
I hope to increase the quantity of free stuff distributed for our class, and to make sure that there is enough.
I intend to advocate for cheaper textbooks and free online resources that are used in class.
It is my hope to create new traditions and activities to increase student engagement.

President.introduction: Salutations! I’m Leo Solga and I’m running to serve as your bow-tie-wearing Class President and UA Representative. I want to coordinate outstanding class events and improve student life at Penn, and I have the experience and drive to make it happen. We deserve an excellent and unique freshman experience starting with a phenomenal Econ Scream! Additionally, I intend to work to improve and support our currently ineffective psychological counseling services. If elected, I would be committed to serving as your President and UA Rep and would take on no more extracurricular responsibilities. Thank you, and godspeed!
President.name: Leo Solga
platform_points: I have years of experience getting things done in Student Government, including serving as my High School’s Student Body President.
I will be committed to serving you. I will take on no more extracurricular responsibilities.
I will work on improving Penn’s psychological counseling services. Penn should not have the most depressed student body in American higher education.
I will plan and host memorable and unique freshmen events!
I will listen to your voice and remain easily accessible for thoughts, suggestions, or concerns.

President.introduction: I’m Abhay Srivastava and I’m running for Class President and UA New Student Rep because I hope to create a more diverse, inclusive, and sustainable Penn. As a first-generation American, I recognize the importance of appreciating and celebrating the many identities that Penn students embody. If elected, I will consider student voices from all backgrounds to host class events that unify the Penn community through their differences. As someone who values others’ opinions, I will work alongside Penn’s administration to accommodate the asks of the student body, and to ensure student feedback lies at the core of our initiatives.
President.name: Abhay Srivastava
platform_points: Hosting opportunities for students to engage with local non-profits and environmental organizations to reduce environmental waste, promote sustainability, and encourage community engagement
Giving students a voice and their own platform through surveys, suggestion boxes, etc. and incorporating feedback to create exciting and relevant events and changes
Developing a greater breadth of diverse and inclusive events for Penn students to appreciate everyone's unique background and gain unique cultural perspectives
Creating a more robust mental health support system for students by making resources and assistance more accessible and equitable for students who need it
Working directly with Penn administration and incorporating student opinion and feedback on ways to enact change on pressing issues affecting Penn and the local community
Extending the range of dining dollars to a greater amount of local food stores/restaurants

President.introduction: Hey everyone! My name is Jaideep Grewal but I also go by “deep”, “dj deep dog”, and “jai-shallow”. If those names don’t ring a bell, I am easily identifiable as the kid who is always running through the quad and loudly singing and speaking to every person I see (as a means to procrastinate from work). Ok, I am getting off topic (as you can see my crippling ADHD is shining through), but I think I have the perfect mix of experience, diligence, enthusiasm, optimism, and drive to lead our class this year.
President.name: Jaideep Grewal
platform_points: FUN: Classes, clubs, and school in general are stressful. I commit to establishing as many fun social events as possible (with free food, of course).
PRINTERS: Especially for those in the quad and in CAS, we have to take a long trek to find a printer. I commit to making printers more accessible everywhere.
FACILITIES: I commit to establishing more routine cleanings of bathrooms and all public areas. Temperature fluctuations will also be taken care of.
MENTAL HEALTH: Many general resources are listed on campus pages, but are they really accessible? I commit to making mental health resources easily accessible through virtual consults.
FOOD/DRINKS: I commit to having vending machines in every house, and easy pick-up points for food deliveries at the entrances of every house.
CLUBS/CLASSES: I commit to concentrating all club apps into one common application and making Path@Penn easier to use.

President.introduction: With the experience I—Diego Font—have accumulated throughout the leadership roles I held in high school, such as Student Council President, I can unequivocally assert my readiness to lead you as Class President. Effectively, I will fight for your interests and work for you with the utmost sense of responsibility, excellence, professionalism, and goodwill. Now, I am not a quitter, and I will be the 24/7 President that you need and want. Ultimately, it would be an honor to be able to serve and work for what I love and treasure most about Penn: the people that make it up.
President.name: Diego A. Font
platform_points: I will organize social gatherings, namely barbecues, music festivals, excursions, balls, Freshmen Winter and Summer Olympics, etc., to foster camaraderie among us. I also pledge to uphold Penn’s deep-rooted traditions.
I will bring about adaptations of popular game shows, such as America’s Got Talent, Family Feud, Jeopardy!, and Countdown, among others, for you to participate and indulge in at Irvine Auditorium.
I will lay the foundations for a yearbook that reminisces our Academic Year 2022/23 by establishing a Yearbook Committee you could join. The Official Class Board 2026 Instagram will be created too.
I will actively pursue sponsorships and arrange fundraisers. Most will be aimed at procuring you a faster and more efficient method of transportation of your choosing, like skateboards and scooters.

I will assemble a study group for each course that you are presently taking; these groups will convene weekly. Freshmen from each course will moderate and chair their respective sessions as volunteers.

Lastly, my central purpose is to provide you with the representation you justly deserve, for your voice matters; your concerns, initiatives, and suggestions will be taken into account. Reach me: 787-379-7373.

President.introduction: Hello! My name is Vedika Jawa and I’m originally from California. I enjoy playing basketball (hit me up for a 1v1), camping (thank you PennQuest), and taking lots of pictures! I know that all of us are coming from such different high school experiences and have found ourselves overwhelmed at some point in these past three weeks. I want to make our transition to freshman year as smooth as possible. I’ll make sure that freshman traditions, like EconScream, are memories we will treasure while also initiating new social events. If you like Wawa, then you’ll like Jawa :)
President.name: Vedika Jawa
platform_points: Cultural Diversity -  Hold social gatherings every month with food from different cultures each time (Cuban, Vietnamese, and more) to further celebrate and represent Penn’s international diversity.
Inclusivity - Organize parties and social events such as a homecoming dance and class sleepover (you won’t need to know a brother to get into these - I promise!)
Equity - Focusing on making sure that students of all backgrounds have an equal opportunity to engage in class experiences. i.e. : subsidizing costs for new class merch drops

President.introduction: I'm Daniel Robinson and I'm from Bethesda Maryland. I came to Penn knowing I would be surrounded by the best. As a community, I believe we deserve the best, especially seeing that we are the first post-pandemic class to join Penn. Our special status puts us in a position to lead Penn to new heights and I would be honored to lead us there.
President.name: Daniel Robinson
platform_points: Making Penn a welcoming place for all students
Making students aware of all of Penn's resources
Revisiting Penn's fantastic traditions to host fun and exciting class-wide events

President.introduction: As an international, South African student, bringing people together from different backgrounds is culturally important to me. Unlike the undergraduate assembly who are involved in making policy changes, a class president is supposed to be representative of and able to unite the student body. As someone who balances the M&T workload, a vibrant social life, an intensive fitness program, and my family, I doubt there are many individuals who I do not represent in at least one of these aspects. As a class president, I would be committed to preserving and improving our traditions and to uniting the student body.
President.name: Gabriel Dyssell-Hofinger
platform_points: Firstly, seasonal social activities such as freshman snowball fight with all classes cancelled for the first snow day of the year
Secondly, I want to bring a taste of South Africa and host monthly “Braais” (much better barbeques) in the quad which will be open to all freshman
Thirdly, bringing together social activities and mental health awareness by implementing monthly puppy therapy sessions
Fourthly, organizing subsidized beach days with accessible transportation and free food
Fifthly, day trip to New York city to expose UPenn students to all the Big Apple has to offer
Sixthly, a water day with water guns, balloons, ice cream and slip and slide

President.introduction: I'm Martina Bulgarelli from Italy. I enjoy meeting new people and learning about new cultures. I have been involved in student government since freshman year in high school from being class to school coordinator. I also obtained a position in the Italian National Student Council representing more than 1,5 million students. Being passionate about giving a voice to minorities and making everyone feel comfortable in this new experience are some of the reasons I am running for President of Class Board and member of the Undergraduate assembly.
President.name: Martina Bulgarelli
platform_points: Mindfulness: camping by the beach - relax after midterms
Action: olympenn - sport and arts tournament of the year
Remember: Time capsule - collect our wishes for the future, to be opened after graduation
Talent: Class merch design talent - get creative, submit your design, it might be the one printed on class hoodies
Inclusivity: Traditions festival - traditional clothing parade and cooking challenge

Executive_VP.introduction: Hi! My name is Hersha Chauhan and I am running for Executive Vice President of the Class of 2026. If I am honored to represent you this year, I will dedicate myself to making our freshman year as memorable and rewarding as possible. As a member of our Class Board I will work to ensure that we begin our journey of four years together through various events that will promote positivity, facilitate significant change, and ultimately, unite the Class of 2026 for years to come.
Executive_VP.name: Hersha Chauhan
platform_points: Togetherness. We all have unique backgrounds and we should celebrate this diversity, forge genuine connections, and build our class spirit.
Outreach. As Penn students and frankly as citizens we have a duty to make an impact and get involved with the greater community of West Philadelphia in a meaningful way.
Mental Health. It is time to redefine the stigma around mental health at Penn. The culture must change, it is as simple as that.
And on a less serious note- free food/events/merchandise because why not?
Finally, I want to hear from you, because in all honesty that is what my position on student government will be all about. Reach out at 203-505-9311

Executive_VP.introduction: Hello! I’m Isaac Tang and I’m from Miami. I’m currently in CAS, studying Math (that is the most boring fact about me, promise). Outside of the classroom, I’m in Counterparts, one of Penn’s acapella groups, and I hope to get more involved in the Philly community. I'm running to represent you because I’d love to get to know each of you good looking people, and bring our class together through fun events because, as Mr. Worldwide once sang, “One’s company, two’s a crowd and three’s a party.” We have a little more than three students, but we’ll make it work.
Executive_VP.name: Isaac Tang
platform_points: Encourage our class to explore the greater Philadelphia community through social events and parties downtown
Promote class spirit through more free Penn merchandise
Expand our student body’s cultural knowledge through free food and culinary events
Host more events to display Penn’s performing and visual arts
Create opportunities to get outside of Philly and network with other Ivy league students
Create opportunities to get outside of Philly and network with other Ivy league students

Executive_VP.introduction: What's up Penn! I’m Jack Annicelli from Bedford, New York (go Yankees) and I'm running for Executive Vice-President because I believe in giving back. I want to have a positive impact on what seems to be an awesome community. A vice-president’s job is not to push their own agenda, but to listen to what their classmates want. I’ll be the voice directing traffic where you want. The reality is that freshman Class Board is more limited than upper Class Boards, so don’t get misled by others’ lofty promises. Let’s have a great year.
Executive_VP.name: Jack Annicelli
platform_points: Initiate opportunities (joint local community + Penn sporting events and music recitals?) to engage with and have a positive impact on the Philadelphia community and teach Penn students about their city.
Extending dining hall hours (so we don’t have to walk from the Quad to Lauder at 10pm).
Create an efficient system for all freshmen voices to be heard so that your Class Board is working FOR YOU (that’s why it exists).
YOU TELL ME.
I’ll wait to hear from you.
Again, up to you.

Executive_VP.introduction: I’m Colby Snyder, a student in the College and Engineering from Reading, Pennsylvania, and I’m running for Executive Vice President of the Class of ‘26. I’m passionate about sustainability and bridging the opportunity gap, and I intend to bring these values to the Class Board. If I’m elected, I plan to work with the administration to advance environmental and social responsibility at Penn. Most importantly, I’ll ensure that student voices are heard to plan engaging first-year events and spark meaningful change.
Executive_VP.name: Colby Snyder
platform_points: Working alongside Philly non-profits and environmental groups to reduce food waste and single-use plastic consumption at Class Board-organized events.
Implementing accessible and frequently checked message boxes and digital surveys to make student voices a factor in planning and improving events.
Increasing communication between the student body and administration to facilitate action on issues at Penn and in the surrounding community.
Coordinating large-scale volunteer events for students to interact in a non-academic setting while giving back to West Philly.

Executive_VP.introduction: Hi everyone! My name is Koustav Datta, I am from New Hampshire, and I am interested in running for Class Board Executive Vice President, as well as a representative of the Undergraduate Assembly. Student Government has always appealed to me, and I am thoroughly interested in becoming involved with such an organization at Penn because it would bless me with the opportunity to foster connections with the members of my Class, incorporate activities that the Class of 2026 would want to see take place, and to create a tighter-knit community with the greatest class Penn has ever seen.
Executive_VP.name: Koustav Datta (Stav)
platform_points: - Bolstering school spirit with a Sadie Hawkins Dance (a dance where the girls ask their significant others out to the dance)
- Hosting activities on the College Green every month, such as a field day for the Class of 2026.
- Hosting an exclusively Class of 2026 picnic in the later months of the school year (when the temperature warms up).

- Hosting a Powderpuff game (a football game where the girls play football and the guys cheerlead, where cheerleaders volunteer as coaches for the boys and football players volunteer as coaches for the girls).
- Organizing a Class of 2026 Scavenger Hunt on Penn's Campus and Central Philadelphia (teams based on Residential College Houses)
- And the most important point, being open to listening to people for their suggestions on what they truly believe could make 2022-2023 a valuable and enjoyable year for the Class of 2026.

Executive_VP.introduction: Hello Class of 2026, My name is Juan Lopez and I am excited to run for the Executive Vice President and UA position. I am majoring in Political Science and I’m from the Bay Area. I am running to be able to advocate for each and every student at Penn! I will try my best to make our freshmen year at Penn memorable by making sure we have fun bonding class events and free Penn merch since we know how expensive it can be at the bookstore *cough cough*. Be sure to check my Instagram for more details @lopez4viceprez!
Executive_VP.name: Juan Lopez
platform_points: I’ll make sure to advocate for the needs of every student at Penn! You’ll all have my socials or email and can let me know of any questions or concerns.
As I’ll be in the loop on most things, I will make sure to let everyone know of anything that might not be beneficial to our class.
Making Penn a more collaborative community rather than a competitive one!
Increase the financial aid a student receives/ have the financial office take other things into account regarding one’s EFC!
Support the FGLI community with more resources to succeed at Penn and create a strong community within one another!
Advocate for a change in dining hall food options… specifically Hill and Commons!
